lemma even_plus_linear_diff:
  fixes g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real" and c x :: real
  assumes "g (-x) = g x"
  shows "(g x + c * x) - (g (-x) - c * x) = 2 * c * x"
proof -
  have "(g x + c * x) - (g (-x) - c * x) = g x - g (-x) + 2 * c * x" by simp
  also have "... = 0 + 2 * c * x" using assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma elimination_aux_general:
  fixes a b c d e f :: real and x w :: real
  assumes "a * e - b * d \<noteq> 0"  
      and eq1: "a * x + b * w = c"
      and eq2: "d * x + e * w = f"
  shows "x = (c * e - b * f) / (a * e - b * d)"
proof -
  have "e * (a * x + b * w) = e * c" using eq1 by simp
  moreover have "b * (d * x + e * w) = b * f" using eq2 by simp
  ultimately have "a * e * x + b * e * w - (b * d * x + b * e * w) = e * c - b * f"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  hence "(a * e - b * d) * x = e * c - b * f"
    by sos
  with assms show ?thesis by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1" 
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"
proof -
  have eq_t: "t = 3*(9 - 2*t) + 1"
    using assms by simp
  hence "t = 28 - 6*t" by simp
  then have "7 * t = 28" by simp
  hence t_eq: "t = 4" by simp
  have s_eq: "s = 9 - 2 * 4" using assms by simp
  hence "s = 1" by simp
  thus "s = 1 \<and> t = 4" using t_eq by simp
qed

theorem multi_distrib_complex_3terms:
  fixes a b c d e f :: complex
  shows "(a + b + c) * (d + e + f) = a*d + a*e + a*f + b*d + b*e + b*f + c*d + c*e + c*f"
proof -
  have "(a + b + c) * (d + e + f) = (a + (b + c)) * (d + e + f)" by simp
  also have "... = a*(d + e + f) + (b + c)*(d + e + f)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + (b + c)*(d + e + f)" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + (b*(d + e + f) + c*(d + e + f))" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + b*d + b*e + b*f + c*d + c*e + c*f" 
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma elimination_aux:
  fixes x w :: real
  assumes eq1: "3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
      and eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  have mult1: "9 * x + 12 * w = 30"
    using eq1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have mult2: "-8 * x - 12 * w = -16"
    using eq2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x = 14" by (smt (verit) eq1)
  thus "x = 14" .
qed

lemma elimination_equation:
  fixes x w :: real
  assumes eq1: "3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
      and eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
  shows "x = 14"
proof -
  have mult1: "9 * x + 12 * w = 30"
    using eq1 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have mult2: "-8 * x - 12 * w = -16"
    using eq2 by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have "9 * x + 12 * w + (-8 * x - 12 * w) = 30 + (-16)"
    using mult1 mult2 by simp
  hence "x = 14" by simp
  thus "x = 14" .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
    shows "x = 14"
proof -
  define w where "w = y - 3 * z"
  have y_eq: "y = w + 3 * z" unfolding w_def by simp
  have eq1: "3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
    using assms(1) y_eq by simp
  have eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
    using assms(2) y_eq by simp
  show "x = 14" using elimination_aux[OF eq1 eq2] .
qed

theorem a_times_inv_comm:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "a * (1 / a) = 1" and "(1 / a) * a = 1"
proof -
  have "a * (1 / a) = (1 / a) * a" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  moreover have "a * (1 / a) = 1" using assms by (simp add: field_simps)
  ultimately show "a * (1 / a) = 1" and "(1 / a) * a = 1" by simp_all
qed

fun num_from_digits :: "nat list \<Rightarrow> nat" where
  "num_from_digits [] = 0" |
  "num_from_digits (d#ds) = d * 10^(length ds) + num_from_digits ds"


(* A simple lemma showing that num_from_digits works as expected for three digits. *)

lemma num_from_digits_3_digits:
  fixes a b c :: nat
  shows "num_from_digits [a, b, c] = 100 * a + 10 * b + c"

definition digit_weight :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> nat" where

lemma base_conversion:

theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  have "f (-3) = a * (-3)^4 - b * (-3)^2 + (-3) + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  hence "f (-3) = 81 * a - 9 * b - 3 + 5" by simp
  also have "... = 81 * a - 9 * b + 2" by simp
  ultimately have eq: "81 * a - 9 * b + 2 = 2" using assms(2) by simp
  hence "81 * a - 9 * b = 0" by simp
  have "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  hence "f 3 = 81 * a - 9 * b + 8" by simp
  thus "f 3 = 8" using \<open>81 * a - 9 * b = 0\<close> by simp
qed

lemma substitute_values:
  fixes b :: nat
  assumes "gcd 120 b = 8" and "lcm 120 b = 3720"
  shows "120 * b = 8 * 3720"
  using assms
  by (smt (verit) prod_gcd_lcm_nat)

lemma lcm_gcd_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b"
proof -
  have "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b"
    using prod_gcd_lcm_nat by simp
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma lcm_gcd_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  shows "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b"
proof -
  have "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b"
    using prod_gcd_lcm_nat by auto
  hence "lcm a b * gcd a b = a * b"
    by (simp add: mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma gcd_subtract:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a \<le> b"
  shows "gcd a b = gcd a (b - a)"
proof -
  have "gcd a b = gcd a (b - a)"
    using assms by (smt (verit) gcd.commute gcd_diff1_nat)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma gcd_even_modified:
  fixes a :: nat
  assumes "even a" and "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "gcd a 2 = 2"
proof -
  from assms have "2 dvd a"
    by auto
  moreover have "gcd a 2 \<le> 2"
    using \<open>2 dvd a\<close> by (simp add: dvd_imp_le)
  moreover have "2 \<le> gcd a 2"
    using \<open>2 dvd a\<close> by auto
  ultimately show "gcd a 2 = 2" by simp
qed

lemma gcd_subtraction:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a \<ge> b" "b > 0"
  shows "gcd a b = gcd (a - b) b"
proof -
  from assms have "gcd a b = gcd (a - b) b"
    by (metis gcd_diff1_nat)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma gcd_even_evolved:
  fixes a :: nat
  assumes "even a" and "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "gcd a 2 = 2"
proof -
  from assms have "2 dvd a" by auto
  then have "gcd a 2 = 2" by (simp add: dvd_imp_le)
  thus ?thesis .
qed

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_222
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_222:
  fixes b :: nat
  assumes "lcm 120 b = 3720"
    and "gcd 120 b = 8" 
  shows "b = 248"
proof -
  
  have prod_equiv: "lcm 120 b * gcd 120 b = 120 * b" 
    by (simp add: lcm_gcd_product)
  
  have "120 * b = 3720 * 8"
    using prod_equiv assms by simp
  
  then have "120 * b = 29760" by simp
  
  then have "b = 29760 div 120" 
    by (simp add: Nat.div_mult_self)
  
  then have "b = 248" by simp 
  thus ?thesis .
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_435
  imports Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_435:
  fixes k :: nat
  assumes "0 < k"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 3) = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 2) = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 1) = 1" 
  shows "5 \<le> k"
proof -
  
  {
    assume H: "k < 5"
    
    consider (One) "k = 1" | (Two) "k = 2" | (Three) "k = 3" | (Four) "k = 4"
      using H by auto
    then have False
    proof cases
      case One
      
      
      have "gcd (6 * (1::nat) + 1) (6 * 1 + 1) = gcd 7 7" using One by simp
      also have "... = 7" by simp
      ultimately have "gcd (6 * 1 + 1) (6 * 1 + 1) \<noteq> 1" by simp
      moreover from assms(4) have "gcd (6 * 1 + 1) (6 * 1 + 1) = 1" by simp
      ultimately show False by contradiction
    next
      case Two
      
      
      have "gcd (6 * 0 + 2) (6 * 0 + 2) = gcd 2 2" using Two by simp
      also have "... = 2" by simp
      ultimately have "gcd (6 * 0 + 2) (6 * 0 + 2) \<noteq> 1" by simp
      moreover from assms(3) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 2) (6 * 0 + 2) = 1" by simp
      ultimately show False by contradiction
    next
      case Three
      
      
      have "gcd (6 * 0 + 3) (6 * 0 + 3) = gcd 3 3" using Three by simp
      also have "... = 3" by simp
      ultimately have "gcd (6 * 0 + 3) (6 * 0 + 3) \<noteq> 1" by simp
      moreover from assms(2) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 3) (6 * 0 + 3) = 1" by simp
      ultimately show False by contradiction
    next
      case Four
      
      
      have "gcd (6 * 0 + 4) (6 * 0 + 2) = gcd 4 2" using Four by simp
      also have "... = 2" by simp
      ultimately have "gcd (6 * 0 + 4) (6 * 0 + 2) \<noteq> 1" by simp
      moreover from assms(3) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 4) (6 * 0 + 2) = 1" by simp
      ultimately show False by contradiction
    qed
  }
  
  thus "5 \<le> k" by auto
qed

end
```

lemma abs_diff_cases:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x > 0" and "abs (x - 1/x) = 1"
  shows "x - 1/x = 1 \<or> 1/x - x = 1"
proof -
  consider "x - 1/x \<ge> 0" | "x - 1/x < 0"
    by linarith
  then show ?thesis
  proof cases
    case 1
    with assms have "abs (x - 1/x) = x - 1/x"
      by (simp add: abs_if)
    with \<open>abs (x - 1/x) = 1\<close> have "x - 1/x = 1"
      by simp
    then show ?thesis
      by auto
  next
    case 2
    with assms have "abs (x - 1/x) = -(x - 1/x)"
      by (simp add: abs_if)
    with \<open>abs (x - 1/x) = 1\<close> have "-(x - 1/x) = 1"
      by simp
    also have "-(x - 1/x) = 1/x - x"
      by simp
    finally have "1/x - x = 1" .
    then show ?thesis
      by auto
  qed
qed

lemma abs_diff_cases_nonzero:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" and "abs (x - 1/x) = 1"
  shows "x - 1/x = 1 \<or> x - 1/x = -1"
proof -
  from assms(2) have "x - 1/x = 1 \<or> x - 1/x = -1"
    using abs_eq_iff[of "x - 1/x" 1] by auto
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma abs_eq_cases:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b \<ge> 0" and "abs a = b"
  shows "a = b \<or> a = -b"
proof (cases "a \<ge> 0")
  case True
  then have "abs a = a" by simp
  with assms show "a = b \<or> a = -b" by simp
next
  case False
  then have "a < 0" by auto
  then have "abs a = -a" by simp
  with assms have "-a = b" by simp
  hence "a = -b" by simp
  then show "a = b \<or> a = -b" by simp
qed

lemma quad_roots:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x^2 + x - 1 = 0"
  shows "x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 - sqrt 5)/2"
proof -
  have "x^2 + x = 1" using assms by simp
  then have "x^2 + x + 1/4 = 1 + 1/4" by simp
  hence "(x + 1/2)^2 = 5/4" by sos
  then have "x + 1/2 = sqrt (5/4) \<or> x + 1/2 = - sqrt (5/4)" 
    by (smt (verit) L2_set_mult_ineq_lemma \<open>x\<^sup>2 + x = 1\<close> assms diff_add_cancel floor_one floor_zero mult_diff_mult numeral_One one_add_floor one_power2 one_power2 power2_eq_iff power2_eq_square power2_sum power_minus power_minus_Bit0 real_sqrt_ge_one real_sqrt_le_0_iff real_sqrt_le_1_iff real_sqrt_mult real_sqrt_one real_sqrt_sum_squares_mult_ge_zero real_sqrt_sum_squares_mult_squared_eq real_sqrt_zero sqrt_le_D sum_power2_eq_zero_iff zero_power2 zero_power2)
  moreover have "sqrt (5/4) = sqrt 5 / 2" by (metis dbl_inc_simps(5) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) real_sqrt_divide real_sqrt_four)
  ultimately have "x + 1/2 = sqrt 5 / 2 \<or> x + 1/2 = - sqrt 5 / 2" 
    by simp
  then have "x = (-1 + sqrt 5) / 2 \<or> x = (-1 - sqrt 5) / 2" by auto
  thus ?thesis .
qed

lemma am_gm_two:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" and "y > 0"
  shows "(x + y) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (x * y)"
proof -
  have "((x + y) / 2)^2 = (x^2 + 2 * x * y + y^2) / 4" by (smt (verit) field_sum_of_halves power2_diff power2_sum power_divide real_less_lsqrt real_less_rsqrt real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_gt_0_iff real_sqrt_lt_0_iff real_sqrt_pow2_iff sum_squares_bound)
  also have "x^2 + 2*x*y + y^2 \<ge> 4 * x * y" 
  proof -
    have "(x - y)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
    hence "x^2 - 2 * x * y + y^2 \<ge> 0" by sos
    then have "x^2 + y^2 \<ge> 2 * x * y" by simp
    then show ?thesis by simp
  qed
  finally have "((x + y) / 2)^2 \<ge> x * y" by (smt (verit) add.commute field_le_epsilon field_sum_of_halves mult_2 power2_sum ring_class.ring_distribs(2) sum_squares_bound)
  then show ?thesis
    by (metis arith_geo_mean_sqrt assms(1) assms(2) less_eq_real_def)
qed

lemma divide_inequality:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < c" and "a \<le> b"
  shows "a / c \<le> b / c"
proof -
  have "1 / c > 0" using assms by auto
  then have "a * (1 / c) \<le> b * (1 / c)" using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus "a / c \<le> b / c" by simp
qed

lemma am_gm_sqrt:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x \<ge> 0" and "y \<ge> 0"
  shows "(x + y) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (x * y)"
proof -
  have sq_ineq: "(x + y)^2 \<ge> 4 * x * y"
  proof -
    have "(x - y)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
    then have "x^2 - 2 * x * y + y^2 \<ge> 0" by sos
    hence "x^2 + 2 * x * y + y^2 \<ge> 4 * x * y" by simp
    then show ?thesis by (simp add: power2_sum)
  qed
  note sq_ineq
  moreover have "sqrt ((x + y)^2) = x + y"
  proof -
    from assms have "x + y \<ge> 0" by simp
    then show ?thesis by auto
  qed
  moreover have "sqrt 4 = 2" by simp
  ultimately have "x + y \<ge> 2 * sqrt (x * y)"
    by (metis mult.commute mult.left_commute real_sqrt_le_iff real_sqrt_mult)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma powr_exponentiation:
  fixes t :: real
  shows "2 powr (2 * t) = 4 powr t"
proof -
  have "2 powr (2 * t) = (2 powr t) * (2 powr t)"

  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  assumes eq: "\<forall>x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"

  ultimately have "f 3 - f (-3) = (a * (3^4) - b * (3^2) + 3 + 5)
                                - (a * (3^4) - b * (3^2) - 3 + 5)" by simp
  also have "... = 6" by simp
  finally have "f 3 = f (-3) + 6" by simp
  with f_neg3 show "f 3 = 8" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_388:
  fixes x y z :: real
  assumes "3 * x + 4 * y - 12 * z = 10"
      and "-2 * x - 3 * y + 9 * z = -4"
    shows "x = 14"
proof -
  define w where "w = y - 3 * z"
  have eq1: "3 * x + 4 * w = 10"
    using assms(1) w_def by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have eq2: "-2 * x - 3 * w = -4"
    using assms(2) w_def by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have eq2': "2 * x + 3 * w = 4"
    using eq2 by simp
  have eq1_mult: "6 * x + 8 * w = 20"
    using eq1 by simp
  have eq2_mult: "6 * x + 9 * w = 12"
    using eq2' by simp
  have w_val: "w = -8"
  proof -
    have " (6 * x + 9 * w) - (6 * x + 8 * w) = 12 - 20" by (simp add: eq1_mult eq2_mult)
    hence "w = -8" by simp
    thus ?thesis .
  qed
  have "2 * x + 3 * (-8) = 4"
    using eq2' w_val by simp
  hence "2 * x - 24 = 4" by simp
  hence "2 * x = 28" by simp
  thus "x = 14" by simp
qed

  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"

  then have "gcd a b * lcm a b = gcd a b * (abs (a * b) div gcd a b)"

```isabelle
theory amc12a_2002_p13
  imports Complex_Main
begin


lemma quad_roots:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x^2 + x - 1 = 0"
  shows "x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 - sqrt 5)/2"
proof -
  have "x^2 + x = 1" using assms by simp
  then have "x^2 + x + 1/4 = 1 + 1/4" by simp
  hence "(x + 1/2)^2 = 5/4" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  then have "x + 1/2 = sqrt (5/4) \<or> x + 1/2 = - sqrt (5/4)" by auto
  moreover have "sqrt (5/4) = sqrt 5 / 2" by simp
  ultimately have "x + 1/2 = sqrt 5 / 2 \<or> x + 1/2 = - sqrt 5 / 2" by simp
  then have "x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 - sqrt 5)/2" by auto
  thus ?thesis .
qed


lemma pos_abs_equiv:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x > 0" and "abs (x - 1/x) = 1"
  shows "x = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
proof -
  
  have "x - 1/x = 1 \<or> 1/x - x = 1"
    using assms by (simp add: abs_if split: if_splits)
  then show ?thesis
  proof
    assume A: "x - 1/x = 1"
    
    have "x^2 - x - 1 = 0" using A by (simp add: field_simps)
    
    then have "x = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (1 - sqrt 5)/2"
      by (simp add: quadratic_formula)
    then show "x = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
      using assms by auto
  next
    assume B: "1/x - x = 1"
    
    have "x^2 + x - 1 = 0" using B by (simp add: field_simps)
    
    then have "x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 - sqrt 5)/2"
      using quad_roots by auto
    then show "x = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> x = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
      using assms by auto
  qed
qed


theorem amc12a_2002_p13:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
      and h1: "a \<noteq> b"
      and h2: "abs (a - 1/a) = 1"
      and h3: "abs (b - 1/b) = 1" 
    shows "a + b = sqrt 5"
proof -
  
  have A: "a = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> a = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
    using h0 h2 pos_abs_equiv by auto
  have B: "b = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 \<or> b = (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
    using h0 h3 pos_abs_equiv by auto
  
  then have "a + b = (1 + sqrt 5)/2 + (-1 + sqrt 5)/2"
    using h1 by auto
  
  thus "a + b = sqrt 5" by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2020_p22
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem amc12b_2020_p22:
  fixes t :: real
  shows "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 1 / 12"
proof -
  
  have pos_case: "t > 0 \<and> 2 powr t - 3 * t > 0 \<or> \<not>(t > 0 \<and> 2 powr t - 3 * t > 0)"
    by auto
  then show ?thesis
  proof
    assume H: "t > 0 \<and> 2 powr t - 3 * t > 0"
    
    let ?A = "2 powr t - 3 * t"
    let ?B = "3 * t"
    
    have A_pos: "?A > 0" using H by simp
    have B_pos: "?B > 0" using H by simp
    
    have "((?A) + (?B)) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (?A * ?B)"
      using A_pos B_pos by (simp add: am_gm_sqrt[of ?A ?B])
    
    then have "2 powr t / 2 \<ge> sqrt ((2 powr t - 3 * t) * 3 * t)" by simp
    
    then have "(2 powr t / 2)\<^sup>2 \<ge> (sqrt ((2 powr t - 3 * t) * 3 * t))\<^sup>2"
      by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
    
    have lhs: "(2 powr t / 2)\<^sup>2 = 4 powr t / 4" 
      by (simp add: powr_exponentiation)
    
    have rhs: "(sqrt ((2 powr t - 3*t) * 3*t))\<^sup>2 = (2 powr t - 3*t) * 3*t"
      by simp
    
    hence "4 powr t / 4 \<ge> (2 powr t - 3*t) * 3*t" using lhs rhs by simp
    
    then have "(2 powr t - 3*t)*t \<le> 4 powr t / 12"
      by (simp add: field_split_simps)
    
    then show ?thesis by (simp add: field_split_simps)
  next
    assume H: "\<not>(t > 0 \<and> 2 powr t - 3*t > 0)"
    
    have "((2 powr t - 3*t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 0"
    proof -
      
      have pos_denom: "4 powr t > 0" by simp
      
      have "(2 powr t - 3*t) * t \<le> 0"
      proof (cases "t > 0")
        case True
        then have "2 powr t - 3*t \<le> 0" using H by auto
        then show ?thesis by simp
      next
        case False
        then show ?thesis by simp
      qed
      with pos_denom show ?thesis by (simp add: divide_nonneg_pos)
    qed
    
    then show ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

end
```

```isabelle
  finally show "b = 248" .
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_numbertheory_435
  imports Complex_Main
begin


theorem mathd_numbertheory_435:
  fixes k :: nat
  assumes "0 < k"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 3) = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 2) = 1"
    and "\<forall> n. gcd (6 * n + k) (6 * n + 1) = 1" 
  shows "5 \<le> k"
proof (rule ccontr)
  
  assume "\<not> (5 \<le> k)"
  
  then have k_less: "k < 5" by simp
  
  have "k \<in> {1,2,3,4}"
  proof -
    from assms(1) and k_less have "1 \<le> k" by simp
    moreover from k_less have "k \<le> 4" by auto
    ultimately show ?thesis by auto
  qed
  
  then consider (One) "k = 1" | (Two) "k = 2" | (Three) "k = 3" | (Four) "k = 4" by auto
  then show False
  proof cases
    case One
    
    have "gcd (6 * (1::nat) + 1) (6 * (1::nat) + 1) = gcd 7 7" by simp
    then have "gcd 7 7 = 7" by simp
    moreover from assms(4) have "gcd (6 * 1 + 1) (6 * 1 + 1) = 1" by simp
    ultimately show False using One by simp
  next
    case Two
    
    have "gcd (6 * (0::nat) + 2) (6 * 0 + 2) = gcd 2 2" by simp
    then have "gcd 2 2 = 2" by simp
    moreover from assms(3) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 2) (6 * 0 + 2) = 1" by simp
    ultimately show False using Two by simp
  next
    case Three
    
    have "gcd (6 * (0::nat) + 3) (6 * 0 + 3) = gcd 3 3" by simp
    then have "gcd 3 3 = 3" by simp
    moreover from assms(2) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 3) (6 * 0 + 3) = 1" by simp
    ultimately show False using Three by simp
  next
    case Four
    
    have "gcd (6 * (0::nat) + 4) (6 * 0 + 2) = gcd 4 2" by simp
    then have "gcd 4 2 = 2" by simp
    moreover from assms(3) have "gcd (6 * 0 + 4) (6 * 0 + 2) = 1" by simp
    ultimately show False using Four by simp
  qed
qed

end
```

lemma am_gm_simple:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<ge> 0" and "b \<ge> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (a * b)"
proof -
  have "(a - b)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 \<ge> 0" by sos
  hence "a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2 \<ge> 4 * a * b" by simp
  then have "(a + b)^2 \<ge> 4 * a * b" by sos
  then have "sqrt ((a + b)^2) \<ge> sqrt (4 * a * b)"
    using assms by (metis mult.commute mult.left_commute power2_eq_square real_sqrt_le_iff)
  hence "a + b \<ge> 2 * sqrt (a * b)"
    using assms by (metis add_increasing2 mult.commute mult.left_commute real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_mult real_sqrt_pow2_iff real_sqrt_power)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma pos_divide_ineq:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "c > 0" and "a \<le> b"
  shows "a / c \<le> b / c"
proof -
  have "a / c = a * (1/c)" by simp
  moreover have "b / c = b * (1/c)" by simp
  moreover have "1 / c > 0" using assms by simp
  ultimately show "a / c \<le> b / c"
    by (metis assms(1) assms(2) divide_right_mono dual_order.strict_iff_not)
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<ge> 0" and "b \<ge> 0"
  shows "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (a * b)"
proof -
  have "((a + b) / 2)^2 = (a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2) / 4"
    by (smt (verit) add.commute power2_sum power_divide real_sqrt_four real_sqrt_pow2)
  also have "a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2 \<ge> 4 * a * b"
  proof -
    have "(a - b)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
    then have "a^2 - 2 * a * b + b^2 \<ge> 0" by sos
    hence "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> 2 * a * b" by simp
    then show ?thesis by simp
  qed
  ultimately have "((a + b) / 2)^2 \<ge> a * b" by simp
  then have "sqrt (((a + b) / 2)^2) \<ge> sqrt (a * b)"
    using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  hence "abs ((a + b) / 2) \<ge> sqrt (a * b)" by simp
  moreover from assms have "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  ultimately show "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (a * b)" by simp
qed

lemma divide_by_positive:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "c > 0" and "a \<ge> b"
  shows "a / c \<ge> b / c"
proof -
  have "a / c = a * (1/c)" by simp
  also have "b / c = b * (1/c)" by simp
  moreover have "1/c > 0" using assms by simp
  ultimately have "a * (1/c) \<ge> b * (1/c)"
    using assms mult_left_mono[of "1/c" b a] by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma triple_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d e f :: complex
  shows "(a + b + c) * (d + e + f) = a*d + a*e + a*f + b*d + b*e + b*f + c*d + c*e + c*f"
proof -
  have "(a + b + c) * (d + e + f) = (a + (b + c)) * (d + e + f)" by simp
  also have "... = a*(d + e + f) + (b + c)*(d + e + f)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + (b + c)*(d + e + f)" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + (b*(d + e + f) + c*(d + e + f))" 
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = a*d + a*e + a*f + (b*d + b*e + b*f) + (c*d + c*e + c*f)" 
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_44:
  fixes s t :: real
  assumes "s = 9 - 2 * t"
    and "t = 3 * s + 1" 
  shows "s = 1 \<and> t = 4"
proof -
  have "t = 3 * (9 - 2 * t) + 1"
    using assms by simp
  hence "t = 27 - 6 * t + 1" by simp
  hence "t = 28 - 6 * t" by simp
  then have "7 * t = 28" by simp
  hence "t = 4" by simp
  then have "s = 9 - 2 * 4"
    using assms by blast
  hence "s = 1" by simp
  thus ?thesis using \<open>t = 4\<close> by simp
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma cancel_div':
  fixes x a b c :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0" and "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x" using assms(2) by simp
  hence "a * x + x * (b / x) = c * x" by sos
  with assms show ?thesis by simp
qed

    using eq2 by (simp add: distrib_left)
  have "9 * x + 12 * w + (-8 * x - 12 * w) = 30 + (-16)"

theorem mathd_algebra_398:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "0 < a" "0 < b" "0 < c"
      and eq1: "9 * b = 20 * c"
      and eq2: "7 * a = 4 * b"
  shows "63 * a = 80 * c"
proof -
  have "b = (7 * a) / 4" using eq2 by (simp add: field_simps)
  hence "9 * ((7 * a) / 4) = 20 * c" using eq1 by simp
  then have "(9 * 7 * a) / 4 = 20 * c" by simp
  then have "63 * a = 80 * c" by (simp add: field_simps)

lemma solve_for_b:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "gcd a b * lcm a b = a * b" and "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "b = (gcd a b * lcm a b) div a"
proof -
  have "a dvd (a * b)" by simp
  hence "(a * b) div a = b" using dvd_div_mult_self by (metis assms(2) nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left)
  moreover from assms have "(gcd a b * lcm a b) div a = (a * b) div a" by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp

```isabelle
theory amc12b_2020_p22
  imports Complex_Main "HOL-Library.Sum_of_Squares"
begin


theorem amc12b_2020_p22:
  fixes t :: real
  shows "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 1 / 12"
proof (cases "t > 0")
  
  case False
  
  then have "t \<le> 0" by simp
  moreover have "4 powr t > 0" 
    using powr_gt_zero[of 4 t] by simp
  ultimately have "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 0" 
    by (simp add: divide_nonpos_pos)
  then show ?thesis by simp
next
  
  case True
  then have t_pos: "t > 0" by simp
  
  {
    
    assume A: "2 powr t - 3 * t < 0"
    then have "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) < 0" using t_pos by simp
    moreover have "4 powr t > 0" 
      using powr_gt_zero[of 4 t] by simp
    ultimately have "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) / (4 powr t) < 0" 
      by simp
    then have "((2 powr t - 3 * t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 1/12" by simp
  }
  {
    
    assume B: "2 powr t - 3 * t \<ge> 0"
    
    have am: "((2 powr t - 3*t) + 3*t) / 2 = 2 powr t / 2" by simp
    
    have gm: "2 powr t / 2 \<ge> sqrt ((2 powr t - 3*t) * (3*t))"
      using B t_pos
      by (rule am_gm_simple)
    
    then have "(2 powr t)^2 / 4 \<ge> (2 powr t - 3*t) * (3*t)"
      by (simp add: power2_ge_iff)
    
    then have "4 powr t / 4 \<ge> (2 powr t - 3*t) * (3*t)" 
      by (simp add: powr_mult)
    then have "4 powr t \<ge> 12 * t * (2 powr t - 3*t)" by simp
    
    then have "((2 powr t - 3*t) * t) \<le> (4 powr t) / 12" 
      by simp
    then have "((2 powr t - 3*t) * t) / (4 powr t) \<le> 1/12" 
      using powr_gt_zero[of 4 t] by simp
  }
  thus ?thesis by blast
qed

end
```

```isabelle
theory mathd_algebra_246
  imports Complex_Main
begin




theorem mathd_algebra_246:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x. f x = a * x^4 - b * x^2 + x + 5"
    and "f (-3) = 2" 
  shows "f 3 = 8"
proof -
  
  have "f (-3) = a * ((-3)^4) - b * ((-3)^2) + (-3) + 5"
    using assms(1) by simp
  
  also have "... = 81*a - 9*b + 2" by simp
  ultimately have "81*a - 9*b + 2 = f (-3)" by simp
  
  hence "81*a - 9*b = 2 - 2" using assms(2) by simp
  hence "81*a - 9*b = 0" by simp
  
  have "f 3 = a * 3^4 - b * 3^2 + 3 + 5" using assms(1) by simp
  
  also have "... = 81*a - 9*b + 8" by simp
  ultimately have "f 3 = 81*a - 9*b + 8" by simp
  
  hence "f 3 = 0 + 8" by simp
  thus "f 3 = 8" by simp
qed

end
```

```isabelle
    using eq2 by (simp add: distrib_left)

    using eq1_scaled eq2_scaled by simp

  
  then show "x = 14" .
```
